channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump is pushing for a ‘big cut’ from the Fed—but he’s already on a losing streak
item.description: Trump failed to oust Fed Governor Lisa Cook and is unlikely to get the steep rate cut he demands, as Powell and the FOMC weigh weaker jobs data.

item.title: ‘Peak Goldilocks’: The markets have bought the Fed rumors — watch for them to sell on the news
item.description: Markets will move on Wednesday after Wall Street parses Cook’s statement and his Q&A for clues about future rate cuts beyond Wednesday.

item.title: Scientists confirm what employees already know: Working from home really does make you happier
item.description: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella may think that remote work weakens social ties and makes workers less innovative, but the research is in and one thing is ...

item.title: Appeals court rejects Trump bid to unseat Federal Reserve governor Lisa Cook
item.description: A federal appeals court Monday rejected President Trump's move to fire Federal Reserve board member Lisa Cook.

item.title: The first person to get a Neuralink chip in his brain says he met Elon Musk on the day of his surgery: ‘He’s a cool dude’
item.description: The 31-year-old Neuralink brain-computer interface recipient says he and Musk later discussed SpaceX and had an "alien talk."

item.title: House Republicans honor Charlie Kirk while Dem leaders skip Capitol prayer vigil

item.title: California state Sen. Scott Wiener labels Charlie Kirk 'a vile bigot who' normalized 'dehumanization'
item.description: Democratic California state Sen. Scott Wiener claimed that "Charlie Kirk was a vile bigot," asserting that Kirk normalized "dehumanization."

item.title: Trump says he would have lowered flags for Minnesota slayings if asked. But he didn't call governor

item.title: Appeals court blocks Trump from firing Fed's Lisa Cook, setting stage for SCOTUS clash
item.description: The 2-1 ruling is a near-term blow to Trump, who fired Cook last month on social media.

item.title: ‘A Martyr For The Christian Faith’: Attendees Highlight Charlie Kirk’s Legacy Of Faith At Packed Kennedy Center Vigil
item.description: 'Charlie touched a generation,' one attendee told The Federalist, 'he activated them.'

item.title: Why blaming ‘the left’ is easier than deterring violence after Charlie Kirk’s murder
item.description: Trump dismisses right-wing extremism concerns following Charlie Kirk's assassination, sparking debate over political blame and violence in America.

item.title: Getting Fired For Celebrating Kirk’s Assassination Is Not Cancel Culture, It’s Accountability
item.description: Celebrating the brutal murder of a civilian lacks morals and requires far more accountability than mere ‘cancel culture’ can afford.

item.title: Drugmakers Have a Right to Advertise
item.description: The First Amendment applies to commercial speech as well as political speech.

item.title: AI Will Destroy Entire Industries, and That’s a Good Thing
item.description: After each wave of innovation, our country has emerged more prosperous and economically capable. This time will be no different.

item.title: America in Real Life Must Not Be as Rabid as America Online
item.description: If we honor Charlie Kirk’s legacy of good-faith engagement, we will reflexively step back from the precipice.
